item.title: Report X-2024061230
item.description:
Report X-2024061230

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AUDITOR NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE HAD A STAINED CORNER AND NOTIFIED THE DMP RESPONDER. RESPONDER RETURNED TO PROCESSING AREA AND DISCOVERED THAT ONE OF THE INNER CONTAINERS HAD A LOOSE CAP, WHICH LEAKED AND STAINED THE OUTER FIBERBOARD BOX. BECAUSE THE CONTAINERS HAVE VENTED CAPS, THEY CANNOT BE RETURNED IN A SALVAGE DRUM. ALL WERE DISPOSED VIA THE DMP.

item.title: Report E-2024060436
item.description:
Report E-2024060436

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-11
  • City: FARMINGTON
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 11, 2024, four (4) 1-gallon pails of UN3264 were crushed in transit and released approximately 2.5-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. ER discovered that R+L personnel had placed four damaged drums into one (1) 15-gallon drum. ER personnel utilized a neutralizing agent to remediate the trailer. Granular absorbents were then placed on the impacted areas and swept using hand tools. ER then broke down the impacted pallet completing remediation. All spent absorbents as well as the pallet were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Both drums were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024061019
item.description:
Report X-2024061019

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-11
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A HAZMAT AUDITOR BROUGHT TRAM BY AND SAID THEY HAD A HAZMAT PACKAGE WITH CLASS 5.1 AND 8 DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS THAT THEY THOUGHT MAY BE LEAKING AS THERE WAS A STONG CHEMICAL SMELL COMING FROM THE PACKAG. RESPONDER OPENED UP THE PACKAGE AND FOUND 4 1GAL CONTAINERS WITH VENTED CAPS AND THE INSIDE CARDBOARD TO BE WET. FURTHER INSPECTION SHOWED 1 OF THE CONTAINERS HAD A VERY LOOSE CAP THAT HAD ALLOWED THE CONTENTS OF THE CONTAINER TO LEAK OUT.

Report X-2024061018

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AUDITOR NOTICED WET CORNER ON THE PACKAGE AND NOTIFIED THE RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER TOOK THE PACKAGE TO THE PROCESSING AREA AND DISCOVERED THAT ONE INNER CONTAINER HAD A LOOSE CAP. BECAUSE THE CONTAINERS HAVE VENTED CAPS, THEY MAY NOT BE RETURNED TO THE SHIPPER IN A SALVAGE DRUM. ALL ITEMS DISPOSED.
